title: Phased Training Design for Competitive Behavior Development in Adolescent Tennis Athletes

context.prior_knowledge: Advanced theoretical knowledge and mastery of high-level application skills
context.additional_context: Educational program for general citizens to understand the mathematical analysis of tennis performance development principles in adolescents, cultivating practical video analysis and data interpretation skills using a step-by-step training model (MT)

learning_goals: Learners can explain the correlation between step-by-step Mini-Tennis (MT) training phases and actual match behaviors through data analysis.
Learners can measure key metrics such as rally length, serve success rate, and shot type frequency using a tennis match video analysis tool (notational analysis).
Learners can statistically evaluate the impact of MT phase-based training design on skill development in adolescent athletes.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
